The Director of Public Prosecutions has the following contact details:
1220 København K
1220 Copenhagen K
Tlf.: 72 68 90 00, mail: rigsadvokaten@ankl.dk
Telephone: 72 68 90 00, e-mail: rigsadvokaten@ankl.dk
Udover den centrale anklagemyndighed er der en lokal anklagemyndighed i hver af landets 12 politikredse.
In addition to the central prosecution service, each of Denmark’s 12 police districts has a local prosecution service.
Henvendelser om behandlingen af personoplysninger i den lokale anklagemyndighed skal rettes til Rigspolitiet eller vedkommende politikreds.
You have to send communication concerning the processing of personal data by the local prosecution service to the Director of Public Prosecutions or the relevant local police district.
Hvis du er i tvivl om, hvilken politikreds er relevant i dit tilfælde, kan du kontakte Rigspolitiet.
If you feel in doubt as to the police district that will be relevant in your case, you may contact the office of the National Commissioner of Police.
Du kan læse mere om deres behandling af personoplysninger på Rigspolitiets hjemmeside www.politi.dk.
You may read more about their processing of personal data at the website of the national police: www.politi.dk.
Databeskyttelsesrådgiver
Data protection officer
Rigsadvokaten har udpeget en databeskyttelsesrådgiver for den centrale anklagemyndighed, som inddrages i alle spørgsmål om beskyttelse af personoplysninger.
The Director of Public Prosecutions has appointed a data protection officer for the central prosecution service, who will be consulted in all matters of personal data protection.

Databeskyttelsesrådgiveren har til opgave at rådgive Rigsadvokaten, de øvrige embeder i den centrale anklagemyndighed og de ansatte om korrekt og sikker behandling af personoplysninger under hensyntagen til de registreredes og andre berørte personers rettigheder og legitime interesser.

The data protection officer’s responsibility is to provide advice to the Director of Public Prosecutions, the other entities of the central prosecution service and the staff on correct and secure processing of personal data, taking into account the rights and legitimate interests of the data subjects and other individuals concerned.
Databeskyttelsesrådgiveren samarbejder med Datatilsynet og fungerer som Datatilsynets kontaktpunkt hos Rigsadvokaten.
The data protection officer collaborates with the Data Protection Agency and serves as the Data Protection Agency’s contact point at the office of the Director of Public Prosecutions.
Databeskyttelsesrådgiveren kan oplyse dig nærmere om reglerne for databeskyttelse.
The data protection officer can give you more detailed information about the data protection rules.

Databeskyttelsesrådgiveren kan også vejlede dig om dine rettigheder i forhold til behandlingen af personoplysninger, herunder hvor du skal rette henvendelse, hvis du ønsker at gøre brug af dine rettigheder.

The data protection officer may also provide you with guidance on your rights relative to the processing of personal data and tell you what authorities you have to contact if you want to exercise your rights.
Du kan læse mere om databeskyttelsesrådgiverens opgaver i § 31 i retshåndhævelsesloven og artikel 39 i EU’s databeskyttelsesforordning.
You may read more about the data protection officer’s functions in section 31 of the Law Enforcement (Data Processing) Act and Article 39 of the EU General Data Protection Regulations.
Databeskyttelsesrådgiveren hos Rigsadvokaten er:
The data protection officer at the Director of Public Prosecutions is:
Anna Alexandra Pontoppidan
Mette Vennekilde
Tlf.: 72 68 90 00, mail: databeskyttelsesraadgiver@ankl.dk
Telephone: 72 68 90 00, email: databeskyttelsesraadgiver@ankl.dk
Klageadgang
Complaints procedure
Datatilsynet er tilsynsmyndighed for behandlingen af personoplysninger.
The Data Protection Agency is the supervisory authority for personal data processing.
Du kan klage til Datatilsynet over vores afgørelser om din indsigtsret mv. og over vores behandling af oplysninger om dig.
You may file a complaint to the Data Protection Agency about our decisions concerning your right of access etc. and our processing of personal data concerning you.

Du har også ret til at lade Datatilsynet udøve dine rettigheder i forhold til behandlingen af dine oplysninger, hvis vi har truffet afgørelse om undladelse, udsættelse, begrænsning eller nægtelse af dine rettigheder efter kapitel 4-6 i retshåndhævelsesloven.

You are also entitled to let the Data Protection Agency exercise your rights in relation to the processing of your data if we have made a decision not to comply with or to postpone, restrict or deny your rights according to sections 4 – 6 of the Law Enforcement (Data Processing) Act.
Du kan læse mere om Datatilsynet og se tilsynets vejledning om dine rettigheder som registreret og om klageadgang mv. på Datatilsynets hjemmeside www.datatilsynet.dk.

You may read more about the Data Protection Agency and see the Agency’s guidelines on your rights as a data subject and your access to file complaints etc. at the Data Protection Agency’s website: www.datatilsynet.dk.
Datatilsynets kontaktoplysninger er:
The Data Protection Agency’s contact details are:
Datatilsynet Borgergade 28, 5.
Data Protection Agency, Borgergade 28, 5.
Du kan som hovedregel selv beslutte, hvem du gerne vil have som forsvarer under straffesagen.
As a general rule, you are allowed to decide whom you want as your defence counsel during the case.
Hvis du er under 18 år, er det dog forældremyndighedsindehaveren, der har ret til at vælge, hvilken forsvarer du skal have.
If you are under 18, however, the holder(s) of parental custody is/are entitled to choose your defence counsel.
I en række tilfælde vil retten beskikke en offentlig forsvarer for dig.
In a number of cases, the court will appoint a public defence counsel for you.
Det betyder bl.a., at salæret til advokaten i første omgang bliver betalt af det offentlige.
This means, amongst other things, that the fees for the defence counsel will initially be paid out of public funds.
Hvis du bliver dømt, vil det offentlige efterfølgende opkræve omkostningerne hos dig.
If you are convicted, the state will subsequently recover the costs from you.
Læs mere om sagsomkostninger.
Read more about case costs.
Du kan bede politiet eller retten om at få en bestemt advokat som din beskikkede forsvarer.
You can ask the police or the court to have a specific attorney appointed as your defence counsel.
Det er retten, der afgør, om betingelserne for at beskikke en forsvarer er opfyldt.
The court will decide whether the conditions for appointing a defence counsel are satisfied.
Advokatsamfundet har en oversigt over alle danske advokater.
The Danish Bar and Law Society has a list of all Danish attorneys.
Retten har en liste med advokater, der er udpeget til at blive beskikket i straffesager.
The court has a list of attorneys who are eligible for appointment in criminal cases.
Hvornår skal der beskikkes en forsvarer?
When must a defence counsel be appointed?
Der skal som udgangspunkt beskikkes en forsvarer i alle straffesager, medmindre der er tale om en mindre alvorlig sag, hvor der eksempelvis alene bliver tale om en bøde.
As a general rule, a defence counsel must be appointed in all criminal cases unless the case is minor, for example, if the sentence will merely be a fixed penalty amount.
Det kan f.eks. være færdselssager om hastighedsoverskridelse, hvor straffen – hvis du bliver dømt – kun er en bøde.
This could be traffic cases concerning a speed violation where – if you are convicted – the penalty will only be a fixed penalty amount.
I mindre alvorlige sager vil der ikke være en forsvarer til stede ved retsmødet, medmindre du selv laver en aftale med en advokat om at være til stede.
In less serious cases, a defence counsel will not be present during the court hearing unless you arrange for the defence counsel to be present.
Læs mere om Advokatsamfundet
Read more about the Prosecution Service
Vær opmærksom på, at anklagemyndigheden har ophavsretten til billederne i billedbiblioteket.
Please be aware that the Prosecution Service holds the copyrights to the photos in the gallery.
Billederne kan frit anvendes, forudsat at anklagemyndigheden krediteres som kilde.
You may use the photos freely, provided that you cite the Prosecution Service as the source.
Vil du vide mere om, hvordan det er at arbejde i anklagemyndigheden?
Read more about the Prosecution Service
Bistandsadvokaten er en gratis advokat, der kan hjælpe dig og varetage dine interesser under hele straffesagen.
The legal advocate is an attorney who can help you and safeguard your interests throughout the criminal justice process, at no cost to yourself.
Bistandsadvokatens rolle
The role of the legal advocate
En bistandsadvokat kan
A legal advocate can
Hjælpe dig og give dig råd og vejledning, mens politiet efterforsker sagen, og hvis sagen senere skal for retten
Help, advise and guide you while the police are investigating the case and if the case goes to court later on.
Rådgive dig, hvis du er bange for, at gerningsmanden skal opsøge dig
Give you advice if you are afraid the perpetrator will contact you.
Hjælpe dig med at få erstatning – ved at opgøre dit erstatningskrav og fremsætte det under en eventuel retssag og over for Erstatningsnævnet
Help you get compensation – by calculating your claim for compensation and submitting it during the court proceedings and to the Criminal Injuries Compensation Board.
Forklare dig, hvordan en straffesag foregår og tage med dig, hvis du skal afgive forklaring i retten som vidne.
Explain how the criminal justice process works and accompany you if you have to testify in court as a witness.
Hvem har ret til en bistandsadvokat?
Who is entitled to a legal advocate?
Når du har været udsat for voldtægt eller en lignende alvorlig seksualforbrydelse, får du en bistandsadvokat, medmindre du ikke ønsker det.
If you have been raped or experienced another similarly serious sexual assault, you will be assigned a legal advocate unless you refuse that option.
Når du har været udsat for anden personfarlig kriminalitet som vold eller røveri, skal du selv bede politiet om at få en bistandsadvokat, hvis du ønsker det.
If you have experienced another type of crime against your person such as violence or robbery, you must ask the police for a legal advocate if you want one.
Politiet vil fortælle om dine muligheder for at få en bistandsadvokat.
The police will tell you about your options for obtaining a legal advocate.
Det er retten, som afgør, hvem der kan få en bistandsadvokat.
The court decides who is eligible for a legal advocate.
Retten beslutter også, hvilken advokat det skal være.
The court also decides which legal advocate to assign.
Hvis du gerne vil have en bestemt advokat til at hjælpe dig, kan du bede om det.
If you want a specific attorney to help you, you must request that person.
Hvis du har været udsat for voldtægt eller lignende, får du mulighed for at tale med din bistandsadvokat, før politiet afhører dig første gang.
If you have been raped or suffered a similar type of assault, you will have an opportunity to talk to your legal advocate before the police interview you the first time.
Nogle gange kan det være nødvendigt, at politiet stiller dig spørgsmål, inden du har talt med din bistandsadvokat.
In some cases, the police may need to ask you questions before you have spoken with your legal advocate.
Se de forskellige faser af en straffesag og læs mere om, hvad der kendetegner dem
The criminal justice process – for you as a witness or victim
Sådan bruger vi cookies
How we use cookies
Vi anvender cookies til at måle trafik på hjemmesiden og dermed optimere og forbedre indhold, struktur og brugeroplevelse via analyse af statistik.
We use cookies to measure traffic on the website and to optimise and improve content, structure, and user experience through statistical analysis.
Du kan altid læse vores cookiepolitik via linket i footeren på hjemmesiden, uanset hvor på hjemmesiden du befinder dig.
You can read our cookie policy at any time in the link in the footer on the website, wherever on the website you are.
Accept eller afvisning af cookies
Accept or decline cookies
Når du besøger vores hjemmeside, får du præsenteret en cookie-funktionalitet, som gør det nemt for dig at tage stilling til, om du vil acceptere eller fravælge cookies.
When you visit our website, you will be shown a cookie banner that makes it easy for you to decide whether to accept or decline the use of cookies.
Ønsker du at acceptere cookies, klikker du blot videre på hjemmesiden og accepterer hermed, at der sættes cookies til ovenstående formål.
If you want to allow cookies, simply continue using the website, thus accepting that cookies will be set for the purposes mentioned above.
Ønsker du at afvise cookies, klikker du blot på ”Afvis cookies”, og der vil derefter ikke blive sat cookies.
If you want to decline cookies, click on "Decline cookies", which means cookies will not be set.
Hvis du efterfølgende ønsker at tilbagekalde dit cookiesamtykke, skal du slette dine cookies i din browsers internetindstillinger (se uddybende beskrivelse nedenfor).
If you later wish to withdraw your consent to cookies, you need to delete cookies in your browser's Internet settings (see more detailed description below).
Herefter vil du ved genindlæsning/ny åbning af hjemmesiden få vist cookiefunktionaliten igen, og du kan vælge at afvise cookies.
If you reload/reopen the website, the cookie banner will reappear so that you can decline cookies.
Du har desuden altid mulighed for at slå cookies fra under internetindstillinger i din browser, eller du kan slette de installerede cookies efter dit besøg på anklagemyndigheden.dk.
You can always disable cookies in the Internet settings of your browser, or you can delete the cookies set after visiting www.anklagemyndigheden.dk.
Du kan også læse mere om og finde vejledninger til, hvordan du sletter dine cookies i forskellige browsere, her:
You can also read more or find guidance on how to delete cookies in various browsers here:
Vejledning i at slette cookies på Microsoft Internet Explorer
How to delete cookies in Microsoft Internet Explorer
Vejledning i at slette cookies på Mozilla Firefox browser
How to delete cookies in Mozilla Firefox
Vejledning i at slette cookies på Google Chrome browser
How to delete cookies in Google Chrome
Vejledning i at slette cookies på Safari browser
How to delete cookies in Safari
Vil du vide mere?
Would you like to know more?
Hvis du vil vide mere om, hvad cookies er, hvordan du blokerer for dem, og hvordan du sletter dem, kan du læse mere på hjemmesiden http://www.minecookies.org/.
If you want to know more about cookies, how to block them, and how to delete them, you can read more (in Danish only) on the website www.minecookies.org.
Om os
About us
Et konfliktråd er et møde mellem dig og gerningsmanden, hvor du under trygge forhold kan tale med gerningsmanden om det, der er sket, og hvordan det har påvirket dig.
Victim-offender mediation is a meeting between you and the offender in which you can talk to the offender in a secure environment about what happened and how it has affected you.
Gerningsmanden kan forklare om sine overvejelser omkring forbrydelsen.
The offender can explain his or her thoughts about the crime.
Det er frivilligt for både dig og gerningsmanden at deltage i mødet.
Participation in the meeting is voluntary for you and the offender.
Der vil være en specialuddannet mægler til stede under mødet.
A specially trained mediator will be present.
Der kan kun afholdes konfliktråd i sager, hvor gerningsmanden har tilstået sin forbrydelse.
Victim-offender mediation is only possible if the offender has admitted his or her guilt.
Politiet foretager en vurdering af, om en sag er egnet til konfliktråd.
The police assess whether a case is suitable for mediation.
Hvis du ønsker at deltage i et konfliktråd, kan du også selv foreslå det til politiet.
If you are interested in participating in victim-offender mediation, you can also suggest it to the police yourself.
Konfliktrådet erstatter ikke en retssag, og gerningsmanden vil stadig blive straffet.
Victim-offender mediation does not replace court proceedings, and the offender will still be punished.
Dommen bliver afsagt, når alle afhøringer i sagen er færdige, og forsvareren og anklageren er kommet med deres afsluttende bemærkninger.
The judgment is delivered when all testimony in the case has been heard, and the prosecution and defence have delivered their closing arguments.
Dommeren giver besked om, hvornår dommen afsiges.
The judge will announce the time and date of its delivery.
Når en dom afsiges og læses op, skal alle tilstedeværende stå op.
When a judgment is delivered and read out, everyone present must rise.
Hvis du er offer i sagen, kan du ringe til rettens kontor og få at vide, hvordan sagen er endt.
If you are a victim in the case, you can call the court's office to find out the verdict.
Du kan også bede retten eller anklagemyndigheden om en gratis kopi af dommen.
You can also ask the court or the prosecution service for a free copy of the judgment.
Normalt har den tiltalte krav på at få sin sag behandlet i både byret og landsret.
The defendant is usually entitled to have his or her case heard in both the district court and the high court.
Hvis tiltalte ikke er enig i byrettens afgørelse, kan han eller hun anke sagen til landsretten.
If the defendant disagrees with the district court's decision, he or she may appeal against the decision and have the case brought before the high court.
Den tiltalte eller anklagemyndigheden skal senest anke inden 14 dage, fra dommen er afsagt.
The defendant or the prosecution service must file their appeal within 14 days of the date the judgment was delivered.
Et offer i en straffesag kan ikke beslutte, om en dom skal ankes til landsretten.
A victim in a criminal case cannot decide whether a judgment should be appealed to the high court.
Det er tiltaltes eller anklagemyndighedens beslutning.
This is a decision for the defendant or the prosecution service.
Dommen bliver afsagt, når dommerne har overvejet sagen (voteret).
The judgment will be delivered when the judges have considered the verdict (deliberated).
Det sker, efter at bevisførelsen er afsluttet, og din forsvarer og anklageren er kommet med deres bemærkninger om sagen (proceduren).
They deliberate after all the evidence has been produced and your defence counsel and the prosecutor have made their closing arguments.
Normalt har du krav på at få din sag behandlet i både byret og landsret.
You are usually entitled to have your case heard in both the district court and the high court.
Hvis du ikke er enig i byrettens afgørelse, kan du derfor anke sagen til landsretten.
If you disagree with the district court's decision, you may appeal against the decision and have the case brought before the high court.
Du kan anke sagen ved at sende et brev til anklagemyndigheden eller til den byret, som har behandlet din sag.
You can file an appeal in your case by sending a letter to the prosecution service or the district court that heard your case.
Du kan ikke anke ved at sende et brev til landsretten.
You cannot appeal by sending a letter to the high court.
Din forsvarer og byretten kan vejlede dig om, hvordan du anker din sag.
Your defence counsel and the district court can guide you on the appeal procedure.
Fristen for anke er 14 dage, fra dommen er afsagt.
The time limit for filing an appeal is within 14 days of the date the judgment was delivered.
Det er din eller anklagemyndighedens beslutning.
This is a decision made by you or the prosecution service.
Straf
Sentence
Hvis retten mener, at du er skyldig, kan du blive idømt en bøde eller fængselsstraf.
If the court finds you guilty, you can be sentenced to pay a fixed penalty or to imprisonment.
Fængselsstraffen kan enten være ubetinget eller betinget.
A prison sentence may be unconditional or suspended.
Hvis straffen er ubetinget, betyder det, at du skal i fængsel i en periode, som retten fastsætter.
If the sentence is unconditional, you will have to go to prison for a period determined by the court.
I nogle tilfælde kan du afsone straffen i fodlænke.
In some situations, you will be allowed to serve your sentence with an ankle tag.
Her kan du læse om afsoning .
Click here to read about serving a sentence.
Hvis straffen er betinget, betyder det, at du ikke skal i fængsel, hvis du i en periode (prøvetiden) overholder nogle vilkår.
If the sentence is suspended, you will not have to go to prison if you comply with certain conditions for a period (the probation period).
Du må ikke begå ny kriminalitet i prøvetiden.
You must not commit any new offences while under probation.
I nogle tilfælde skal du også overholde andre vilkår.
In some situations, you will also be required to comply with other conditions.
Retten kan f.eks. bestemme, at du skal være under Kriminalforsorgens eller kommunens tilsyn eller skal gå i behandling for et misbrug.
For example, the court may decide to subject you to supervision by the Prison and Probation Service or your local authority, or order you to enter addiction treatment.
Retten kan også bestemme, at du skal udføre samfundstjeneste.
The court may also decide that you have to perform community service.
Hvis du overtræder et eller flere vilkår, kan retten bestemme, at du skal afsone din straf i et fængsel.
If you violate one or more of the conditions, the court may decide that you will have to serve your sentence in a prison.
I nogle tilfælde kan retten udover straffen også bestemme, at du bliver frakendt en rettighed, f.eks. retten til at køre bil.
In some situations, the court may decide that, in addition to serving your sentence, you will also be deprived of a right, such as the right to drive a car.
Retten kan også bestemme, at du skal have konfiskeret værdier, og at du skal betale en erstatning til offeret.
The court may also decide to confiscate assets from you and/or order you to pay a compensation amount to the victim.
Hvis du bliver dømt, vil retten normalt bestemme, at du skal betale de nødvendige omkostninger, der har været ved behandlingen af din sag.
If you are convicted, the court will normally decide that you have to pay the necessary costs related to your case.
Sagsomkostningerne vil blandt andet være udgifter til din forsvarer .
This includes your defence counsel expenses.
Herudover kan det f.eks. være udgifter til tekniske undersøgelser, f.eks. DNA- eller lægeerklæringer.
In addition, you may have to pay for forensic examinations such as DNA tests or for medical statements.
Efter dommen vil sagsomkostningerne blive opkrævet af det offentlige.
After the judgment, the public authorities will charge you for the case costs.
Frifindelse
Acquittal
Hvis retten efter at have vurderet sagens beviser mener, at du ikke er skyldig i den tiltale, anklagemyndigheden har rejst, frifinder retten dig.
If, after having considered the evidence in the case, the court finds that you are not guilty of the charge raised against you by the prosecution service, the court will acquit you.
Hvis anklagemyndigheden ikke er enig i rettens afgørelse, har anklagemyndigheden mulighed for at anke sagen til landsretten inden 14 dage, fra dommen er afsagt.
If the prosecution service disagrees with the court's decision, the prosecution service has the opportunity to appeal the case to the high court within 14 days of the date the judgment was delivered.
I nogle tilfælde vil du efter en frifindelse have mulighed for at søge om erstatning.
In some situations, you will be able to claim compensation after having been acquitted.

Hvis du ikke har været indkaldt som vidne i byretten, men har bedt om at få besked om, hvor og hvornår sagen bliver behandlet i byretten, får du også besked, hvis dommen senere bliver anket til landsretten.

If you have not been called as a witness before the district court but have asked to be told where and when the case will be heard in the district court, you will also be notified if the judgment is appealed to the high court at a later time.
I nogle sager kan du bede politiet om at få besked, når gerningsmanden har afsonet sin straf eller bliver prøveløsladt.
In some cases, you can ask the police to inform you when the perpetrator has finished serving his or her sentence or is released on probation.
Det gælder eksempelvis sager om grovere vold eller seksualforbrydelser.
This is particularly relevant in cases of gross violence or sexual assault.
Du kan også bede politiet om at give dig besked om blandt andet gerningsmandens første uledsagede udgang fra fængslet samt ved gerningsmandens medvirken i et tv- eller radioprogram mv.
You can also ask the police to inform you of the perpetrator's first authorised temporary unaccompanied leave from prison and about any radio or TV appearance to be made by the perpetrator, etc.
Det er en betingelse, at gerningsmanden har været varetægtsfængslet inden dommen.
For you to receive this information, the perpetrator must have been remanded in custody prior to conviction.
Din bistandsadvokat eller politiet kan fortælle dig om dine muligheder.
Your legal advocate or the police can tell you more about your options.
Se hvilke organisationer, der kan rådgive og vejlede dig
Read more about the Prosecution Service
Sammen med dommen modtager du en vejledning om anke.
Along with the judgment, you will also receive guidance on how to appeal.
Din forsvarer og byretten kan vejlede dig om, hvordan du anker din sag.
Your defence counsel and the district court can guide you on the appeal process.
Hvis du har en forsvarer, vejleder han eller hun dig om reglerne om anke.
If you have a defence counsel, he or she will advise you on the rules regarding appeals.
Har du ikke en forsvarer, kan retten vejlede dig om reglerne.
If you do not have a defence counsel, the court can provide guidance on the rules.
Erstatning for frihedsberøvelse mv.
Compensation for deprivation of liberty, etc.
Hvis retten mener, at du ikke er skyldig i den tiltale, som anklagemyndigheden har rejst, frifinder retten dig.
If the court finds that you are not guilty of the charge brought against you by the prosecution service, the court will acquit you.
Når du bliver frifundet, vil du i nogle tilfælde have mulighed for at søge om erstatning, f.eks. hvis du har været anholdt eller varetægtsfængslet.
When you are acquitted, you will be able to claim compensation in some situations, for example, if you have been arrested or remanded in custody.
Læs mere om anholdelse og varetægtsfængsling .
Read more about arrest and remand custody.
Hvis anklagemyndigheden – efter efterforskningens afslutning – har besluttet ikke at rejse tiltale mod dig, kan du også have krav på erstatning.
If the prosecution service has decided – after the investigation is completed – not to charge you formally, you may also be entitled to compensation.
Du skal fremsætte dit erstatningskrav inden to måneder efter, at sagen mod dig er afsluttet.
You must file your claim for compensation within two months of the date the case against you was closed.
Det er anklagemyndigheden, der vurderer, om du er berettiget til erstatning.
The prosecution service determines whether you are entitled to compensation.
Hvis du ikke er enig i anklagemyndighedens afgørelse, kan du få den prøvet i retten.
If you disagree with the prosecution service's decision, you can have the decision brought before a court.
Din forsvarer og anklagemyndigheden kan vejlede dig om dine muligheder for at få erstatning.
Your defence counsel and the prosecution service can provide guidance as to your chances of being awarded compensation.
Hvis du bliver idømt en fængselsstraf, vil du blive indkaldt til afsoning, når sagen er slut.
If you are sentenced to imprisonment, you will be called to serve your sentence.
Det er Kriminalforsorgen , der indkalder dig til afsoning.
The Prison and Probation Service will call you to serve your sentence.
Du vil modtage et brev om, hvor du skal afsone.
You will receive a letter informing you where you will serve your sentence.
Typisk får du besked mindst en måned før, du skal afsone.
You will typically be notified at least one month before your sentence starts.
På Kriminalforsorgens hjemmeside er der vejledning om afsoning.
You can find guidance on serving a sentence on the website of the Prison and Probation Service.
På hjemmesiden er der også vejledning til pårørende til frihedsberøvede.
The website also offers guidance for relatives of prisoners.
Retten kan også i særlige tilfælde beslutte, at tiltale helt skal forlade retslokalet, mens du afgiver din forklaring.
The court can also decide in special cases to tell the defendant to leave the courtroom while you are testifying.
Hvis du har været udsat for voldtægt eller en lignende grov forbrydelse, har du ret til at få dørene lukket, mens du afgiver forklaring.
If you have been a victim of rape or a similar serious crime, you have the right to request a closed session while you provide your witness testimony.
Hvis retten beslutter, at dørene ikke skal lukkes under din forklaring, kan retten eventuelt i stedet beslutte, at der skal gælde et referatforbud.
If the court decides that the session will not be closed while you testify, the court may instead decide to impose reporting restrictions.
Retten kan i særlige tilfælde beslutte, at den tiltalte ikke må få dit navn og bopæl at vide.
In special situations, the court may decide to withhold your name and address from the defendant.
Du kan her læse mere om muligheden for at være anonym, når du skal vidne.
Click here to read more about the option of giving evidence anonymously.
I nogle sager vurderer politiet, at der ikke er grundlag for at efterforske sagen, f.eks. fordi det forhold, der er anmeldt, ikke er strafbart.
In some cases, the police deem that there is no basis for investigating the matter reported, for example, because it is not a criminal offence.
Hvis politiet efterforsker sagen, starter de normalt med at afhøre den eller de personer, som ved eller har set noget, der har betydning for sagen.
If the police investigate the case, they will usually begin by interviewing any persons who know or have seen something with a bearing on the case.
Det kan være fingeraftryk, DNA-spor, teleoplysninger eller optagelser fra en videoovervågning.
This could include fingerprints, DNA traces, telecom data, or video surveillance recordings.
Politiet kan i nogle tilfælde under efterforskningen foretage legemsindgreb mod en sigtet eller andre.
In the course of certain investigations, the police may perform body searches on persons who are provisionally charged or on others.
Legemsindgreb omfatter legemsbesigtigelse og legemsundersøgelse.
Body searches may be non-intimate or intimate.
Politiet kan beslutte, om der skal ske legemsbesigtigelse.
The police are legally authorised to perform non-intimate body searches.
En legemsundersøgelse kræver rettens godkendelse, medmindre du eller din forsvarer giver samtykke til indgrebet.
An intimate body search requires court approval unless you or your defence counsel consent to the search.
Legemsbesigtigelse er f.eks. undersøgelse af det tøj, du har på.
A non-intimate body search may entail a search of the clothes you are wearing.
Hvis politiet vejer, måler eller fotograferer dig, tager dit fingeraftryk eller din DNA, er det også en legemsbesigtigelse.
If the police weigh, measure, or photograph you, or take your fingerprints or DNA, this also qualifies as non-intimate body searches.
En legemsundersøgelse er en nærmere undersøgelse af din krop, f.eks. for at finde genstande.
An intimate body search entails a closer inspection of your body, for example, to find objects.
Legemsindgreb foretages ofte i forbindelse med anholdelse.
Body searches are often performed in connection with arrests.
Læs mere om anholdelse .
Read more about arrest.
Hvis politiet vurderer, at der er en rimelig grund til at mistænke en bestemt person for at have begået en forbrydelse, sigter politiet ham eller hende.
If the police find reasonable cause to suspect that a specific person committed a crime, the police will provisionally charge that person.
Som sigtet i en straffesag, har du en række forpligtelser og rettigheder, som politiet vil oplyse dig om.
As a person provisionally charged in a criminal case, you have a number of obligations and rights about which the police will inform you.
Læs mere om dine rettigheder .
Read more about your rights.
Læs om dine muligheder for at få forsvarer.
Read more about your options for getting a defence counsel.
Anholdelse
Arrest
Politiet kan anholde dig, hvis du med rimelig grund er mistænkt for at have begået en forbrydelse.
The police may arrest you if you are reasonably suspected of having committed a crime.
Hvis du har været udsat for en forbrydelse i udlandet, skal du som udgangspunkt anmelde forbrydelsen i det land, hvor den er begået.
If you have been the victim of crime abroad, the general rule is that you must report the crime in the country where it was committed.
Har det ikke været muligt at anmelde forbrydelsen i det land, hvor den er begået, og er den begået i et andet EU-land, kan du anmelde forbrydelsen til dansk politi.
If it was not possible for you to report the crime in the country where it was committed, and it was committed in another EU member state, you can report the crime to the Danish police.

Seksuelle overgreb og grovere vold eller lignende, der er begået i et andet EU-land, kan du anmelde til politiet i Danmark, men det er altid en god idé at anmelde forbrydelsen i det land, hvor den er begået.

Sexual abuse and gross violence, etc., committed in another EU member state can be reported to the police in Denmark, but it is always a good idea to report the offence in the country where the incident occurred.
Bistandsadvokat
Legal advocate
Politiet i Danmark kan fortælle dig om dine muligheder for at få en bistandsadvokat .
The police in Denmark will tell you about your options for obtaining a legal advocate.
Hvis du har en bistandsadvokat i det land, hvor forbrydelsen er begået, kan du ikke (også) få en bistandsadvokat i Danmark.
If you have a legal advocate in the country where the offence was committed, you will not be able to get one in Denmark (as well).
Hvis du har været udsat for personskade eksempelvis efter vold, kan du i nogle tilfælde få erstatning fra staten som følge af den forbrydelse, du har været udsat for.
If you have suffered injuries, for example after violence, as a victim of certain crimes you may be eligible for compensation from the state.
Erstatningen, som ydes efter offererstatningsloven, er dog begrænset til ganske særlige tilfælde, når forbrydelsen er begået i udlandet.
The compensation awarded under the Victims Compensation Act is, however, limited to a very few cases where the offence was committed abroad.
Du har mulighed for at få erstatning, hvis forbrydelsen er sket under en udlandsrejse i forbindelse med dit arbejde.
You may be able to get compensation if the offence was committed during travel abroad in connection with your job.

Efter Erstatningsnævnets praksis kan du som turist få erstatning, hvis skaden er opstået som følge af vold begået af en anden dansker, som du rejser sammen med, for eksempel fordi I er på en skolerejse sammen.

Under the practice of the Criminal Injuries Compensation Board, you will be able to get compensation as a tourist if the injury arose as a consequence of violence committed by another Dane with whom you are travelling – for example, if you are on a school trip together.
I andre tilfælde kan du ikke få erstatning af den danske stat.
In other situations, you will not be eligible for compensation from the Danish state.
Du kan læse mere om betingelserne for at få erstatning efter offererstatningsloven på Erstatningsnævnets hjemmeside.
You can read more about the conditions for getting compensation under the Victims Compensation Act on the website of the Criminal Injuries Compensation Board.
I de tilfælde, hvor du ikke kan få erstatning efter offererstatningsloven, kan du søge om erstatning i det land, hvor forbrydelsen er begået.
In situations when you cannot get compensation under the Victims Compensation Act, you may apply for compensation in the country where the offence was committed.
Erstatningsnævnet kan hjælpe dig med at søge om erstatning.
The Criminal Injuries Compensation Board can help you with the process of applying for compensation.

Hvis forbrydelsen er begået i et land uden for EU, kan Udenrigsministeriets Borgerservice eller den danske ambassade for det pågældende land bistå med at finde en lokal engelsktalende advokat, som kan hjælpe dig med at søge om erstatning.

If the offence was committed in a country outside the EU, the Ministry of Foreign Affairs' Citizens' Services Office or the Danish embassy to the country in question may be able to help you find a local, English-speaking attorney who can help you apply for compensation.
Hvem kan hjælpe?
Who can help?
Hvis du har brug for råd eller vejledning udover den, du får af politiet, anklagemyndigheden eller din bistandsadvokat, er der flere steder, du kan henvende dig.
If you need advice or guidance in addition to what the police, the prosecution service, or your legal advocate gives you, there are several places you can contact.
Offerrådgivningen kan skaffe dig kontakt til professionelle, der tilbyder forskellige former for råd og vejledning.
Victim Support Denmark can put you in contact with professionals who can offer various types of advice and guidance.
Du kan også henvende dig her, hvis du har brug for at tale anonymt med nogen.
You can also contact this service if you need to talk to someone anonymously.
Der er en offerrådgivning i alle politikredse.
Every police district has a Victim Support service.
Find adresser og læs mere på Offerrådgivningens hjemmeside .
You can find addresses and read more on the website of Victim Support Denmark.
Kommunen kan ofte hjælpe, hvis du har brug for støtte som følge af den forbrydelse, du har været udsat for.
Your local authority can often help if you need support as a result of the crime committed against you.
Din læge kan også i nogle tilfælde henvise dig til en psykolog.
In some cases, your own doctor can refer you to a psychologist.
I den situation kan det virke uoverskueligt og hårdt at skulle igennem en politiundersøgelse og måske en retssag.
In this situation, it can seem overwhelming and harsh to have to go through a police investigation and perhaps a court case.
Men det er nødvendigt for at få fuld klarhed over, hvad der er sket med barnet.
But this is necessary to gain a full picture of what has happened to the child.
Kontaktperson
Contact person
Når der bliver anmeldt et seksuelt overgreb mod et barn, udpeger politiet straks en kontaktperson, som du og dit barn kan ringe til, hvis I har spørgsmål eller har brug for at tale om sagen.
When the police receive a report of child sexual assault, they immediately appoint a contact person that you and your child can call if you have questions or need to talk about the case.
Kontaktpersonen er enten en politibetjent eller en anklager.
The contact person is either a police officer or a prosecutor.
Et barn, der har været udsat for et seksuelt overgreb, kan få en gratis advokat.
A child who has been sexually assaulted is entitled to free legal counsel.
Det kaldes en bistandsadvokat.
This is called a legal advocate.
Denne advokat skal varetage barnets interesser under hele straffesagen.
This person will safeguard the interests of your child throughout the criminal proceedings.
Politiets afhøring af børn og unge
The police's questioning of children and young persons
Når der er mistanke om, at der er begået et seksuelt overgreb mod et barn, begynder politiet at efterforske sagen.
When there is suspicion that a child has been sexually assaulted, the police open an investigation into the case.
Politiet starter normalt efterforskningen med at tale med den, der har anmeldt overgrebet, og med andre, der kender noget til sagen.
They usually begin by talking to the person who reported the assault and others with knowledge of the case.
Det er normalt helt afgørende at høre barnets egen forklaring om, hvad der er sket.
It is usually crucial to hear the child’s own explanation of what happened.
Afhøringen af barnet vil ske hurtigst muligt efter anmeldelsen.
The interview with the child will be done as soon as possible after the assault is reported.
I tiden frem til afhøringen er det vigtigt, at voksne så vidt muligt undgår at spørge barnet om overgrebet.
In the time leading up to the interview, it is important for adults to avoid asking the child about the sexual assault – as far as this is possible.
Spørgsmålene kan forstyrre barnets hukommelse og gøre det sværere for politiet at finde ud af, hvad der rent faktisk er sket.
Questions can cloud the child’s memory and make it more difficult for the police to find out exactly what happened.
Videoafhøring
Video-recorded interviews
Børn på 12 år eller derunder bliver som udgangspunkt afhørt til video.
Children aged 12 or under will usually be video-recorded during interviews.
Det betyder, at barnets forklaring bliver optaget på video.
This means the child’s own explanation is recorded on video.
Videoen kan bruges som bevis under retssagen, så barnet ikke skal vidne i retten.
The video may be used as evidence during the court proceedings, so the child does not have to give evidence as a witness in court.
Den politibetjent, der skal videoafhøre dit barn, er specielt uddannet til det.
The police officer who interviews your child during video-recording has been specially trained for the job.
Normalt besøger politibetjenten barnet i hjemmet inden afhøringen.
Usually, the police officer visits the child at home before the interview.
Her får dit barn blandt andet at vide, hvor og hvordan afhøringen skal foregå.
At that time, the child is told how and where the interview will take place.
På den måde bliver barnet bedre forberedt på afhøringen og mere tryg ved, hvad der skal ske.
This prepares the child for the interview and helps make him or her feel more secure about what is going to happen.
Formålet med hjemmebesøget er, at dit barn skal have set og talt med den person, der senere skal foretage afhøringen.
The purpose of visiting the child at home is so the child can see and talk to the person who will later be conducting the interview.
Men dit barn bliver ikke spurgt om overgrebet under dette besøg.
Your child will not be asked about the sexual assault during this visit.
Hjemmebesøget giver politibetjenten et indtryk af dit barn og dets sproglige udvikling.
The home visit gives the police officer an impression of your child and his or her language development.
Det gør det lettere at forberede en god afhøring.
This makes it easier to prepare a good interview session.
Videoafhøringen foregår normalt i et såkaldt børnehus, som er særligt indrettet til formålet.
Video-recorded interviews are usually conducted in a ‘children's house’ specially equipped for the purpose.
Som regel er kun barnet og politibetjenten til stede i lokalet.
Normally, only the child and the police officer are in the room.
Hvis der er brug for det, er der også en tolk.
There will also be an interpreter if needed.
Er det nødvendigt at gøre barnet mere tryg ved situationen, kan der også være en person til stede, som barnet kender godt.
If necessary for the child to feel more secure about the situation, another person who knows the child well may also be present.
Det kan f.eks. være en pædagog fra barnets daginstitution, en bedsteforælder eller et andet familiemedlem.
This could be a nursery teacher from the child’s day-care centre, a grandparent, or another family member.
Det må ikke være én, som skal vidne i sagen senere.
It must not be a person who will be testifying later.
Videoafhøringen bliver samtidig vist på en tv-skærm i et andet lokale børnehuset.
The video is shown simultaneously on a TV screen in another room at the children's house.
Her sidder den politibetjent, som behandler sagen, en anklager, barnets bistandsadvokat og forsvareren for den mistænkte.
In this room are the police officer handling the case, a prosecutor, the child’s legal advocate, and the defence counsel for the suspect.
Der deltager også en repræsentant fra kommunens sociale myndigheder, der skal støtte barnet og være med til at sikre, at afhøringen foregår så skånsomt som muligt.
There will also be a representative from the local authority social services to support the child and help ensure that the interview is carried out as sensitively as possible.
Forældre eller nære pårørende må ikke overvære afhøringen.
Parents or close relatives must not be present during the interview.
Men hvis du følger barnet til afhøringen, er der et sted i børnehuset, hvor du kan vente på dit barn, indtil afhøringen er færdig.
However, if you accompany your child to the interview, there will be a place at the children's house where you can wait until the interview is finished.
Den mistænkte må heller ikke overvære afhøringen, men kan senere gennemse optagelsen sammen med sin forsvarer.
The suspect must not be present during the interview either, but may later see the recording together with his or her defence counsel.
Børn over 12 år bliver som udgangspunkt indkaldt til almindelig afhøring hos politiet og vil eventuelt blive indkaldt som vidne i retten.
Children aged over 12 are usually called in for an ordinary interview by the police, and they may also be called as witnesses in court.
En almindelig afhøring foregår i et lokale på politistationen.
Ordinary interviews take place in a room at the police station.
Normalt er det kun barnet og politibetjenten, der er til stede i lokalet.
Normally, only the child and the police officer are in the room.
Bistandsadvokaten og en repræsentant fra kommunen kan også være til stede.
The legal advocate and a representative from the local authority may also be present.
Det, barnet fortæller, bliver skrevet ned i en afhøringsrapport.
What the child says is taken down in a report.
Politiet vil fortælle dig, om der er brug for en lægeundersøgelse.
The police will tell you if a medical examination is needed.
Det er frivilligt, om du vil lade dit barn blive undersøgt af en læge, men i nogle sager er det nødvendigt for at sikre bevis.
Is it up to you whether to allow your child to be examined by a doctor, but in some cases it is necessary to secure evidence.
Du skal give tilladelse (samtykke) til undersøgelsen.
You will have to give your consent to the examination.
Barnet bliver undersøgt på skadestuen, Center for Voldtægtsofre eller Center for Seksuelle Overgreb af personer, der er uddannet til at undersøge ofre for seksuelle overgreb.

The child will be examined at the hospital casualty department, the Centre for Victims of Rape, or the Centre for Victims of Sexual Abuse by people who are trained to examine victims of sexual assault.
Afhøring af børn og unge i retten
Questioning of children and young persons in court
Hvis barnets forklaring er optaget på video, skal barnet normalt ikke vidne i retten.
If your child’s testimony was recorded on video, the child will not usually be called as a witness in court.
I stedet bliver optagelsen afspillet under retssagen.
Instead, the recording will be played in court.
Hvis barnet har været til almindelig afhøring hos politiet, kan barnet derimod blive indkaldt til at afgive vidneforklaring i retten.
If the police have interviewed your child without a video recording, however, he or she may be called on to testify in court.
Hvis barnet bliver indkaldt som vidne i retten, har barnet pligt til at komme.
If the child is summoned as a witness, he or she has a duty to appear in court.
Bistandsadvokaten ledsager barnet i retten og kan også fortælle, hvordan retsmødet vil foregå.
The legal advocate will accompany the child in court and can also tell you how the court proceedings will take place.
Du kan læse mere om at vidne i retten her.
You can read more about giving evidence in court here.
Du kan være til stede i retten, hvis du ikke selv skal afgive vidneforklaring.
If you are not going to be called upon to testify, you will be permitted to be present in court.
Hvis du skal afgive vidneforklaring, kan du være til stede, efter at du har afgivet forklaring.
If you have to testify, you will be permitted to remain in the courtroom after giving evidence.
Dørene bliver normalt lukket, når barnet afgiver forklaring i retten.
In most cases, the session will be closed while your child testifies.
Det samme gælder, når videooptagelsen af barnets afhøring bliver afspillet.
This will also be the case when the video-recording of the child being interviewed is played in court.
Her kan du læse mere om lukkede døre og særlige hensyn, der kan tages til barnet.
Here you can read more about hearings in closed sessions and about special considerations that may be made in the child’s interests.
Du kan læse om hele straffesagens forløb her
You can read about the criminal justice process here.
Børn, der har været udsat for et seksuelt overgreb, kan søge om erstatning.
Children who have been sexually assaulted can claim compensation.
Staten betaler erstatningen og kan senere opkræve beløbet hos gerningsmanden.
The compensation will be paid out of public funds, and the offender may later be required to repay the amount.
Barnets bistandsadvokat kan besvare eventuelle spørgsmål om erstatning.
The child’s legal advocate can answer any questions you might have about compensation.
Advokaten kan også hjælpe med at opgøre erstatningskravet og fremsætte det på barnets vegne.
The legal advocate can also help calculate the claim and ask for compensation in court on behalf of the child.
Læs mere om erstatning efter offererstatningsloven og om muligheden for en bistandsadvokat .
Read more about compensation under the Victims Compensation Act and about the option of obtaining a legal advocate.
I nogle sager kan du bede politiet om at få besked, når gerningsmanden har afsonet sin straf eller bliver prøveløsladt.
In some cases, you can ask the police to notify you when the perpetrator has finished serving his or her sentence or is released on probation.
Det gælder f.eks. sager om grovere vold eller seksualforbrydelser.
This is particularly relevant in cases of gross violence or sexual assault.
Du kan også bede politiet om at underrette dig om bl.a. gerningsmandens første uledsagede udgang fra fængslet.
You can also ask the police to inform you of the perpetrator's first authorised temporary unaccompanied leave from prison.
Kommunen kan ofte hjælpe, hvis du og/eller dit barn har brug for støtte på grund af det seksuelle overgreb.
Your local authority can often help if you and/or your child needs support after the sexual assault.
Egen læge kan også i nogle tilfælde henvise barnet til en psykolog.
In some cases, your own doctor can refer your child to a psychologist.
Her kan du læse mere om, hvilke øvrige rådgivningstilbud der er for forældre og pårørende til børn, der har været udsat for et seksuelt overgreb.
Here you can read more about the other advisory services available to parents and other close relatives of children who have been sexually assaulted.
Du har som sigtet ret til at få en forsvarer.
As a person who is provisionally charged, you have a right to a defence counsel.
Du kan også læse om dine muligheder for at få en forsvarer og om forsvarens opgave under straffesagen.
You can also read more about your options for getting a defence counsel and about the defence counsel's role during the criminal case.
Læs om varetægtsfængsling og om muligheden for at få besøg
Read more about remand custody and your options for visitation privileges
Se videoen og lær mere om retssagens forløb
Watch the video and learn more about the criminal justice process (in Danish)
Du kan anmelde forbrydelsen telefonisk, skriftligt (også pr. mail) eller ved at møde personligt op på en politistation.
You can report the crime by telephone, in writing (including email), or by going to a police station in person.
Politiet kan også modtage din anmeldelse der, hvor forbrydelsen er sket (gerningsstedet).
The police may also take your report at the scene of the crime.
Det, du forklarer til politiet, er af stor betydning for sagen.
What you tell the police is very important to the case.
Din forklaring hjælper politiet til at opklare sagen, og din forklaring er vigtig, hvis sagen kommer for retten.
Your statement will help the police resolve the case, and your statement will be important if the case goes to court.
Notér din oplevelse ned
Write down your experiences
Det er en god idé at notere det ned, du har oplevet, lige efter det er sket – f.eks. hvad der blev sagt eller gjort eller en beskrivelse af gerningsmanden.
It is a good idea to write down your experiences right after they happen – for example, about what was said or done or a description of the perpetrator.
Læs mere på Domstolsstyrelsens hjemmeside
Read more about the Prosecution Service
Forsikringsselskabet kan under straffesagen anmode om, at den erstatning, som selskabet har udbetalt, betales af gerningsmanden, hvis han eller hun bliver dømt.
During the criminal proceedings, the insurance company may request that the perpetrator repay the compensation it has paid to you if he or she is convicted.
Har du ikke forsikring, eller dækker den ikke (hele) dit tab, kan du bede politiet om at tage dit erstatningskrav med, hvis sagen kommer for retten.
If you do not have insurance, or if your insurance does not cover your (entire) loss, you can ask the police to include your claim for compensation if the case goes to court.
Så skal politiet have bevis for dit tab.
The police will need proof of your loss.
Du kan også selv komme til retsmødet og oplyse om dit erstatningskrav.
You may also attend the court hearing yourself and put forward your claim for compensation.
Politiet kan hjælpe dig, hvis du har spørgsmål om erstatning.
The police can help you with any questions about compensation.
Erstatning efter offererstatningsloven
Compensation under the Victims Compensation Act
Hvis du har været udsat for personskade for eksempel efter vold, kan du i nogle tilfælde få erstatning fra staten som følge af den forbrydelse, du har været udsat for.
If you have suffered injuries, for example after violence, you may sometimes be eligible for compensation from the state due to the crime you suffered.
Du kan normalt kun få erstatning efter offererstatningsloven, hvis du har anmeldt forbrydelsen til politiet inden for 72 timer efter, forbrydelsen er begået.
You are normally only eligible for compensation under the Victims Compensation Act if you report the crime to the police within 72 hours of the incident.
På erstatningsnævnets hjemmeside kan du også finde det skema, du skal bruge, når du søger om erstatning.
On the website of the Criminal Injuries Compensation Board, you can also find the form you need to fill in to apply for compensation.
Politiet kan også hjælpe dig med, hvordan du søger om erstatning.
The police can also help you with the process of applying for compensation.
En forsvarer er en advokat, der hjælper dig under straffesagen.
A defence counsel is a lawyer who helps you during the criminal case.
Forsvarerens opgave er at fungere som din rådgiver under straffesagen.
The defence counsel's job is to be your adviser during the case.
Forsvareren behøver ikke være objektiv, og hans eller hendes opgave er alene at varetage dine interesser.
The defence counsel does not have to be objective, and his or her job is solely to safeguard your interests.
Det gælder både under sagens efterforskning, f.eks. hvis du skal afhøres af politiet, og ved retsmøder i straffesagen.
This applies during the investigation of the case, for example, if you are interviewed by the police, as well as during the court hearings in the case.
Forsvareren vil også kunne besøge dig i fængslet (såkaldte fængselsbesøg) og drøfte sagen med dig, hvis du er varetægtsfængslet.
The defence counsel will also be able to visit you in prison (prison visits) and discuss the case with you if you are in custody.
Læs om varetægtsfængsling.
Read more about custody.
I det følgende kan du bl.a. læse nærmere om dine muligheder for at vælge en forsvarer og mere om, hvilken rolle forsvareren har under straffesagen.
On the following pages, you can read more about your options when choosing a defence counsel and about the role of the defence counsel during the criminal case.
Læs om beskikkelse af forsvarer.
Read about appointment of defence counsels.
Imens politiet efterforsker en mulig straffesag mod dig har forsvareren bl.a. ret til at overvære politiets afhøring af dig.​
While the police are investigating a potential criminal case against you, the defence counsel is entitled to be present during the police's interview with you.
Forsvareren kan også bede politiet om at foretage de efterforskningsskridt, som forsvareren mener, er relevante for sagen.
The defence counsel may also ask the police to take investigative steps that he or she believes are relevant to the case.
Det kan f.eks. være afhøring af vidner eller tekniske undersøgelser – fingeraftryk, DNA-spor, indhentelse af teleoplysninger eller optagelser fra en videoovervågning.
This could include witness interviews or technical examinations – fingerprints, DNA traces, telecom data, or video surveillance recordings.
Hvis politiet ikke mener, at det er relevant at foretage disse efterforskningsskidt, vil det være retten, der beslutter, om de skal gennemføres eller ej.
If the police find these investigative steps irrelevant, the court will have to decide whether they should be carried out.
Forsvareren har som udgangspunkt krav på at få udleveret alt det materiale, som politiet indsamler til brug for straffesagen.
As a general rule, the defence counsel is entitled to receive a copy of all material compiled by the police for the criminal case.
Forsvareren kan vise materialet til dig, men du kan kun få en kopi med politiets tilladelse.
The defence counsel may show you the material, but you can only have a copy if the police allow it.
Under retssagen
During the trial proceedings
Når politiet har afsluttet efterforskningen, beslutter anklagemyndigheden, hvad der videre skal ske.
When the police have completed their investigation, the prosecution service will decide on any further action in the case.
Anklagemyndigheden rejser tiltale, hvis anklageren vurderer, at der er beviser nok til at få dig dømt.
The prosecution service will bring formal charges if the prosecutor finds there is enough evidence to have you convicted.
Herefter er du ikke længere sigtet, men tiltalt.
This means that you are no longer provisionally charged but now formally charged.
Når der er rejst tiltale, er det forsvarerens opgave at hjælpe dig under selve retssagen.
When formal charges are issued, it is the defence counsel's job to assist you during the actual trial proceedings.
Her vil forsvareren bl.a. have mulighed for at afhøre dig og vidnerne i sagen.
This is where the defence counsel will be able to question you and the witnesses in the case.
Forsvarerens opgave er at fremhæve alle de oplysninger og omstændigheder, der taler for, at du ikke er skyldig i den tiltale, som anklagemyndigheden har rejst.
The defence counsel's job is to highlight all the information and circumstances in favour of your not being guilty of the charge issued by the prosecution service.
På samme måde skal forsvareren fremhæve alt det, der taler for, at du – hvis du bliver dømt – skal have en mild straf.
Similarly, the defence counsel must highlight every aspect in favour of your being given a lenient sentence if you are convicted.
Efter retssagen
After the trial proceedings
Når der er afsagt dom i en straffesag, vil retten og forsvareren vejlede dig om mulighederne for at anke sagen.
When a judgment has been delivered in a criminal case, the court and the defence counsel will guide you as to your options for appeal.
Normalt har du mulighed for at få din sag behandlet i både byret og landsret.
You can usually choose to have your case heard in both the district court and the high court.
Du skal have Procesbevillingsnævnets tilladelse til at anke, hvis du er idømt mindre end 20 dagbøder eller en samlet bøde under 3.000 kr.
You will need permission from the Appeals Permission Board to appeal if you have been sentenced to less than 20 day penalties or a total fixed penalty amount of less than DKK 3,000.
Du eller anklagemyndigheden skal anke inden 14 dage, fra dommen er afsagt.
You or the prosecution service must file the appeal within 14 days after the judgment was delivered.
Hvis du har varetægtsfængslet under retssagen, vil retten tage stilling til, om du fortsat skal være varetægtsfængslet.
If you have been in custody during the proceedings, the court will decide whether you should remain in custody.
Her kan du læse mere om udgifter til forsvarer
Here you can read more about defence counsel expenses.
I nogle tilfælde kan der være behov for at frihedsberøve dig i mere end 24 timer.
In some situations, the police may need to detain you for more than 24 hours.
Det er en dommer, der skal tage stilling til, om du kan være frihedsberøvet i længere tid.
A judge will have to decide whether you can be detained for an extended period.
Inden udløbet af 24-timers fristen skal du derfor stilles for en dommer i retten.
This means you have to be arraigned before a judge in court within the 24-hour limit.
Retsmødet kaldes et grundlovsforhør.
This is called a preliminary statutory hearing.
Du vil altid have en forsvarer, hvis du skal i grundlovsforhør.
You will always have a defence counsel if you are arraigned at a preliminary statutory hearing.
Under et grundlovsforhør er der i retten – udover dig og din forsvarer – en dommer og en anklager.
During a preliminary statutory hearing, a judge and a prosecutor will be present in court besides yourself and your defence counsel.
I nogle tilfælde kan det dog være nødvendigt, at offentligheden ikke har adgang til at overvære, hvad der foregår i en del af eller i hele retsmødet.
In some situations, however, it may be necessary to close the hearing to the public for some or all of the hearing.
Anklageren fortæller, hvorfor der er behov for, at du fortsat skal være frihedsberøvet.
The prosecutor will explain why you need to be detained in custody.
Du vil også få mulighed for at udtale dig, og din forsvarer vil redegøre for dit syn på sagen.
You will also get an opportunity to speak, and your defence counsel will explain your position in the case.
Derefter tager dommeren stilling til, om betingelserne for varetægtsfængsling er opfyldt.
Then the judge will decide whether the conditions for remanding you in custody are satisfied.
Alle, der bliver indkaldt til at vidne i retten, har pligt til at komme.
Everyone who is summoned to give evidence as a witness in court is required to appear.
Du kan finde blanketten på domstolenes hjemmeside.
You can find the form on the courts’ website.
Du skal hurtigst muligt give besked til den, som har indkaldt dig til retsmødet, eller til retten, hvis du bliver syg.
You must contact the court or the person who summoned you to appear at the court hearing as soon as possible if you get sick.
Hvis du ikke kommer til retsmødet, og du ikke har givet besked, kan du bl.a. blive idømt en bøde.
If you fail to appear at the court hearing and have not notified the court, you may be ordered to pay a fixed penalty.
Du kan også risikere at blive hentet af politiet og eventuelt anbragt i arresten, indtil du kan blive afhørt i retten.
You also risk being picked up by the police and potentially placed in detention until you can be questioned in court.
Det er retten, der afgør, om du er for syg til at vidne i retten.
The court will decide if you are too sick to testify in court.
Du vil som regel blive indkaldt til et nyt retsmøde, hvis du har haft en gyldig grund til at udeblive.
You will usually be summoned to a new court hearing if you have had a valid excuse for not appearing.
Andre grunde end sygdom, der forhindrer dig i at vidne
Reasons other than illness that prevent you from giving evidence
Travlhed, kurser, forretningsmøder og lignende er ikke gyldig grund til at lade være med at komme til et retsmøde, som du er indkaldt til.
Being busy or having courses, business meetings, etc., are not valid excuses for not showing up at a court hearing for which you have been summoned.
Hvis du har bestilt en udenlandsrejse, før du fik din vidneindkaldelse, gælder det normalt som en gyldig grund for at udeblive.
However, a trip abroad booked before you received the witness summons is normally deemed a valid excuse for not appearing.
Du skal hurtigst muligt give besked til den, som har indkaldt dig til retsmødet, eller til retten, hvis du mener, at du har en gyldig grund for at udeblive.
You must contact the court or the person who summoned you to appear at the court hearing as soon as possible if you think you have a valid excuse for not appearing.
Du vil eventuelt blive bedt om at bevise, at du har en gyldig grund.
You may be asked to provide documentation of a valid excuse.
Hvis du ikke kommer til retsmødet uden at have givet besked, kan du bl.a. blive idømt en bøde.
If you do not show up at the court hearing and have not notified the court, you may be ordered to pay a fixed penalty amount.
Det er retten, der afgør, om du er lovligt forhindret i at vidne i retten.
The court will decide if you have a valid excuse for not testifying in court.
Læs mere om domstolene i Danmark
Read more about the Prosecution Service
En nær pårørende er den, som har stået den afdøde nærmest, for eksempel ægtefælle eller samlever eller et barn.
‘Close relatives’ are those closest to the deceased, such as a spouse, a partner, or a child.
Politiet eller anklagemyndigheden skal bl.a. orientere dig om mulighederne for at følge straffesagen.
The police or the prosecution service must inform you about your options for following the criminal case.
Du skal også have underretning, hvis der bliver rejst tiltale i sagen.
You must also be notified if formal charges are brought in the case.
At rejse tiltale betyder, at sagen bliver sendt til retten.
To bring formal charges means that the case will be brought before the court.
Hvis du beder om det, skal du også have at vide, hvor og hvornår der er retsmøde i sagen.
If you so request, you must also be told where and when any court hearings in the case are being held.
Du bliver også underrettet, hvis politiet eller anklagemyndigheden for eksempel standser efterforskningen eller opgiver at føre en straffesag.
You will also be notified if the police or the prosecution service decide to discontinue investigations or decide not to take the criminal case to court, for example.
Du kan som nær pårørende klage over afgørelserne.
As a close relative, you are entitled to file a complaint against such decisions.
Du kan i særlige tilfælde bede politiet om at få en bistandsadvokat.
In special situations, you can ask the police for a legal advocate.
Travlhed, kurser, forretningsmøder og lignende er ikke gyldig grund til at lade være med at komme til et retsmøde, som du er indkaldt til.
Being busy or having courses, business meetings, etc., are not valid excuses for not showing up at a court hearing.
Du kan således ikke selv vælge, om du har tid eller lyst til at vidne.
This means you cannot decide for yourself whether you have the time or feel like testifying.
Du kan blandt andet blive idømt en bøde, hvis du ikke kommer til retsmødet.
You may be ordered to pay a fixed penalty if you fail to appear at the court hearing.
Du skal også komme, selv om du i nogle særlige situationer ikke er forpligtet til at afgive forklaring.
In certain special circumstances, you are also required to appear even though you do not have a duty to give evidence.
For eksempel hvis du er nær pårørende til den tiltalte i sagen.
For example, you might be a close relative of the defendant in the case.
Nære pårørende er normalt familie (forældre, søskende eller børn) eller partner (ægtefælle eller samlevende).
Close relatives normally include family (parents, siblings, or children) or partners (spouses or live-in partners).
I langt de fleste tilfælde ved retten på forhånd, at du er nær pårørende til den tiltalte, men ellers kan du selv fortælle det, når din afhøring i retten begynder.
In most situations, the court already knows that you are a close relative of the defendant, but if not, you can inform the court when you begin giving your testimony.
Dommeren vil så tage stilling til, om du er forpligtet til at afgive forklaring.
The judge will then decide whether you are required to continue giving evidence.
Hvis du har begået noget strafbart, er du heller ikke forpligtet til at forklare om det, medmindre du allerede er blevet dømt.
If you have committed a criminal offence, you do not have to give evidence about it unless you have already been convicted.
Dommeren vil normalt gøre dig opmærksom på, at du ikke er forpligtet til at forklare om dine egne strafbare handlinger, men at du er forpligtet til at fortælle det om sagen, du ellers kan.
The judge will normally inform you that you are not required to give evidence about your own criminal offences but that you do have to say whatever else you can about the case.
Du kan vælge at vidne, selvom du ikke er forpligtet til det.
You can choose to give evidence although you are not required to do so.
Du kan bl.a. blive idømt en bøde, hvis du ikke kommer til retsmødet.
You may be ordered to pay a fixed penalty if you fail to appear at the court hearing.
Det er eksempelvis, hvis du er nær pårørende til den tiltalte i sagen.
For example, you might be a close relative of the defendant in the case.
I langt de fleste tilfælde ved retten allerede på forhånd, at du er nær pårørende til den tiltalte, men ellers kan du selv fortælle det, når din afhøring i retten begynder.
In most situations, the court already knows that you are a close relative of the defendant, but if not, you can inform the court when you begin giving your testimony.
Du kan som nær pårørende vælge at vidne, selv om du ikke er forpligtet til det.
As a close relative, you can choose to give evidence although you are not required to do so.
I særlige tilfælde kan retten dog beslutte, at den tiltalte f.eks. ikke må få dit navn og bopæl at vide.
In special situations, however, the court may decide to withhold your name and address from the defendant, for example.
Retten kan også i nogle situationer beslutte, at den tiltalte ikke må være til stede i retslokalet, mens du afgiver forklaring.
In some situations, the court may also decide that the defendant cannot be present in the courtroom while you give evidence.

Hvis retten beslutter, at tiltalte ikke må være til stede, vil han eller hun enten sidde i et andet lokale, hvor din forklaring kan høres, eller din forklaring vil blive læst op for ham eller hende, når du er færdig med at vidne.
In that case, the defendant will either sit in another room where he or she can hear your testimony, or your statement will be read aloud to the defendant when you have finished testifying.
Du kan her læse mere om særlige tiltag, der eventuelt kan iværksættes, når du skal vidne i retten.
Click here to read more about the special measures that may be taken when you give evidence in court

The Prosecution Service in the police districts
Henvendelser og forespørgsler til anklagemyndigheden i politikredsene skal rettes direkte til de pågældende embeder og politikredse.
Enquiries and requests addressed to the Prosecution Service in the police districts must be made directly to the offices and police districts concerned.

Skriv sikkert med Digital Post

As a citizen, you can write to us using Digital Post at borger.dk or e-Boks.

If you need to send an email containing sensitive or confidential information, we recommend that you encrypt your email and send it by secure email.

Det er også muligt at få en kontaktperson i andre sager, hvis det er nødvendigt.
You may also be assigned a contact person in other cases if necessary.
Kontaktpersonen kan give dig vejledning og information om din retsstilling og om sagens gang.
The contact person will be able to provide you with guidance and information about your legal position and about the case.
Du kan læse om straffesagens forløb her.
You can read about the criminal justice process here.
Herudover kan kontaktpersonen fortælle om mulighederne for at tage særlige hensyn, når du skal møde i retten.
In addition, the contact person can tell you about your options for special consideration to be taken when you appear in court.
Læs mere om muligheder for særlige hensyn, når du skal vidne i retten.
Read more about your options for special consideration to be taken when you appear in court as a witness.
Du kan tale med politiet om mulighederne for at få en kontaktperson.
You can talk to the police about getting a contact person.
Det er frivilligt, om du vil undersøges, men det er ofte nødvendigt for at sikre beviser.
It is up to you whether to consent to an examination, but one is often necessary in order to secure evidence.
Hvis du har været udsat for vold, skal du tage på skadestuen, umiddelbart efter volden er begået.
If you have experienced violence, you must go to the hospital casualty department immediately after the incident.
På skadestuen bliver du undersøgt af en læge, som beskriver dine skader.
At the hospital casualty department, you will be examined by a doctor who will describe your injuries.
Lægens beskrivelse af dine skader skal bruges som bevis i en eventuel retssag, eller hvis du søger om erstatning efter offererstatningsloven.
The doctor's description of your injuries is required as evidence in a potential court case, or if you apply for compensation under the Victims Compensation Act.
Hvis du har været udsat for et seksuelt overgreb kan det også være nødvendigt, at du bliver undersøgt af en læge.
If you have been sexually assaulted, a doctor may also need to examine you.
Hvis der er det, bliver du undersøgt på skadestuen, Center for Voldtægtsofre eller Center for Seksuelle Overgreb af personer, der er uddannede til at undersøge ofre for seksuelle overgreb.
If so, you will be examined at the hospital casualty department, the Centre for Victims of Rape, or the Centre for Victims of Sexual Abuse by people trained to examine victims of sexual abuse.
Her er links til nogle af organisationerne
Here are links to some of them
Her har du mulighed for at tilmelde dig vores nyhedsabonnementer og modtage nyheder direkte i din mailboks.
This is where you can sign up for our news services and have news sent straight to your inbox.
Frameld - sådan gør du
How to unsubscribe
Ønsker du at afmelde et eller flere af dine nyhedsabonnementer, kan du framelde dig/opdatere dine abonnementer via linket nederst i den nyhedsmail, du får tilsendt.
If you would like to unsubscribe from or update one or more of your news subscriptions, use the link at the bottom of the news mail you receive.
Du vil derefter ikke modtage nyheder fra det pågældende abonnement.
You will subsequently stop receiving news from that category.
Samtykke til behandling af dine personoplysninger
Consent to Processing of Your Personal Data
Ved tilmelding til denne service samtykker du til at Rigsadvokaten som dataansvarlig behandler oplysninger om dig med det formål at udsende det/de ønskede nyheder fra anklagemyndigheden.

When you sign up to this service, you give your consent for the Director of Public Prosecutions as the data controller to process information about you for the purpose of sending the news you want from the Prosecution Service.
Oplysningerne vil blive opbevaret indtil du afmelder dit nyhedsabonnement.
The information will be stored until you cancel your news subscription.
Du har til enhver tid ret til at tilbagekalde dit samtykke, konsekvensen heraf vil være at du ikke længere kan modtage nyhederne fra anklagemyndigheden via denne service.
You are entitled to withdraw your consent at any time, and the consequence will be that you can no longer receive news from the Prosecution Service through this service.
Du har også ret til at anmode om indsigt i de oplysninger, vi behandler om dig, ligesom du har ret til at anmode om at få dine oplysninger berigtiget eller slettet, eller behandlingen begrænset.

In addition, you are entitled to request access to the information we are processing about you, and you are also entitled to request that your information be rectified or deleted or that the processing be limited.
Du har endvidere ret til at gøre indsigelse mod behandlingen af dine oplysninger.
You are also entitled to object against the processing of your data.
Sluttelig har du ret til at anmode Rigsadvokaten om at modtage dine oplysninger i et almindeligt anvendt og maskinlæsbart format.
Finally, you are entitled to request that the Director of Public Prosecutions send you your data in a commonly used and machine-readable format.
Sådanne anmodninger skal fremsendes til rigsadvokaten@ankl.dk eller via post til:
Such requests should be sent to rigsadvokaten@ankl.dk or via post to:
Rigsadvokaten, Frederiksholms kanal 16, 1220 København K.
The Director of Public Prosecutions, Frederiksholms Kanal 16, 1220 Copenhagen K.

Hvis du har spørgsmål til behandlingen af dine personoplysninger herunder fx udøvelsen af dine rettigheder er du meget velkommen til at kontakte Rigsadvokatens databeskyttelsesrådgiver på databeskyttelsesrådgiver@ankl.dk, eller via post til: Rigsadvokaten, Att.

If you have any questions regarding the processing of your personal data, including for example the exercise of your rights, you are welcome to contact the Director of Public Prosecutions' data protection officer at databeskyttelsesrådgiver@ankl.dk or via post to: The Director of Public Prosecutions, Att.
Databeskyttelsesrådgiver Anna Alexandra Pontoppidan, Frederiksholms kanal 16, 1220 København K. Du har endvidere ret til at klage over Rigsadvokatens behandling af dine oplysninger til Datatilsynet.

Data Protection Officer Mette Vennekilde, Frederiksholms Kanal 16, 1220 Copenhagen K. You are also entitled to file a complaint over the Director of Public Prosecutions' processing of your data to the Data Protection Agency.
Datatilsynet kan kontaktes på dt@datatilsynet.dk eller via post til: Datatilsynet, Borgergade 28, 5, 1300 København K
The Data Protection Agency may be contacted at dt@datatilsynet.dk or via post to: The Data Protection Agency, Borgergade 28, 5th floor, 1300 Copenhagen K
